hints.label: def-config-space-rigorous
hints.title: Gauge Orbit and Configuration Space
hints.content:
62: :label: def-config-space-rigorous
63: 
64: For $\mathcal{S} \in \Sigma_N$, the **gauge orbit** is:
65: 
66: $$
67: [\mathcal{S}]_G = \{\sigma \cdot \mathcal{S} : \sigma \in S_N\}
68: 
69: $$
70: 
71: The **configuration space** is the orbit space:
72: 
73: $$
74: \mathcal{M}_{\text{config}} = \Sigma_N / S_N = \{[\mathcal{S}]_G : \mathcal{S} \in \Sigma_N\}
75: 
76: $$

hints.label: prop-stabilizer-structure
hints.title: Structure of Stabilizers
hints.content:
99: :label: prop-stabilizer-structure
100: 
101: Let $\mathcal{S} = (w_1, \ldots, w_N)$ and partition $\{1, \ldots, N\}$ into equivalence classes:
102: 
103: $$
104: \{1, \ldots, N\} = I_1 \sqcup I_2 \sqcup \cdots \sqcup I_m
105: 
106: $$
107: 
108: where $i, j \in I_k$ if and only if $w_i = w_j$.
109: 
110: Then:
111: 
112: $$
113: \text{Stab}_{S_N}(\mathcal{S}) \cong S_{|I_1|} \times S_{|I_2|} \times \cdots \times S_{|I_m|}
114: 
115: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-example-88
hints.title: Stabilizers for Degenerate Configurations
hints.content:
125: :class: tip
126: 
127: **Case 1**: All walkers distinct ($w_i \neq w_j$ for $i \neq j$)
128: - Partition: $I_k = \{k\}$ for all $k$
129: - Stabilizer: $\text{Stab}(\mathcal{S}) = S_1 \times \cdots \times S_1 = \{e\}$ (trivial)
130: 
131: **Case 2**: Two walkers identical ($w_1 = w_2$, rest distinct)
132: - Partition: $I_1 = \{1, 2\}, I_k = \{k\}$ for $k \geq 3$
133: - Stabilizer: $\text{Stab}(\mathcal{S}) \cong S_2 \times S_1 \times \cdots \cong \mathbb{Z}/2\mathbb{Z}$
134: 
135: **Case 3**: All walkers identical ($w_i = w$ for all $i$)

143: :label: def-generic-locus

hints.title: Topological Properties of the Generic Locus
hints.section: ## 1. The Configuration Space as an Orbifold
hints.raw_directive:
158: :::
159: 
160: :::{prf:proposition} Topological Properties of the Generic Locus
161: :label: prop-generic-locus-topology
162: 
163: 1. $\Sigma_N^{\text{gen}}$ is **open and dense** in $\Sigma_N$
164: 2. $\Sigma_N^{\text{sing}}$ is **closed** with empty interior

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-132
hints.content:
167: 
168: :::{prf:proof}
169: **Openness**: The condition "$w_i \neq w_j$" is equivalent to $\|(x_i, v_i) - (x_j, v_j)\| > 0$, which is an open condition in the product topology. The intersection of finitely many open sets is open.
170: 
171: **Density**: For any $\mathcal{S} \in \Sigma_N^{\text{sing}}$ and $\epsilon > 0$, we can perturb the positions/velocities by $\delta < \epsilon$ to make all states distinct, giving a point in $\Sigma_N^{\text{gen}}$.

hints.section: ## 1. The Configuration Space as an Orbifold
hints.raw_directive:
176: ### 1.4. Orbifold Structure Theorem
177: 
178: :::{prf:theorem} Configuration Space as Orbifold
179: :label: thm-config-orbifold
180: 
181: The configuration space $\mathcal{M}_{\text{config}} = \Sigma_N / S_N$ is a **smooth orbifold** of dimension $2Nd$, with:
182: 
183: 1. **Generic part**: $\mathcal{M}_{\text{config}}^{\text{gen}} = \Sigma_N^{\text{gen}} / S_N$ is a smooth manifold
184: 2. **Singular part**: Points in $\mathcal{M}_{\text{config}}^{\text{sing}} = \Sigma_N^{\text{sing}} / S_N$ have non-trivial **orbifold groups** (stabilizers)

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-152
hints.content:
187: 
188: :::{prf:proof}
189: **Dimension**: Since $S_N$ is discrete ($\dim(S_N) = 0$ as a Lie group), the quotient has the same dimension as the total space: $\dim(\mathcal{M}_{\text{config}}) = \dim(\Sigma_N) = 2Nd$.
190: 
191: **Orbifold structure**: By standard orbifold theory, the quotient of a manifold by a discrete group action is an orbifold. The orbifold structure group at $[\mathcal{S}] \in \mathcal{M}_{\text{config}}$ is isomorphic to $\text{Stab}_{S_N}(\mathcal{S})$.
192: 
193: **Generic part is manifold**: On $\Sigma_N^{\text{gen}}$, the action is free, so the quotient is a smooth manifold (by the quotient manifold theorem for free actions).
